com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Class ComponentVisitor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.ComponentVisitor
public abstract class ComponentVisitor
extends Object

An utility class that can be used to perform repetitive functions in a component hierarchy. You need to implement your own subclass of ComponentVisitor that implements the desired functionality within the visiting method. Then call either one of the static methods preOrderVisit or postOrderVisit to perform the function.

Several predefined implementations of ComponentVisitor are provided. These can be obtained by calling one of the static factory methods. For example, if you wanted to set the background color for all components within an AWT Container, you might use something like this code:


   java.awt.Container container;
   ComponentVisitor visitor = ComponentVisitor.getBackgroundVisitor(java.awt.Color.orange);
   ComponentVisitor.postOrderVisit(container,visitor);

Constructor Detail

ComponentVisitor

public ComponentVisitor()
Method Detail

visiting

public abstract void visiting(Component component)
This method is called once for each Component visited in the component hierarchy. Your Visitor subclass must implement this method.

Parameters:
component - the current component that you can manipulate

preOrderVisit

public static void preOrderVisit(Container container,
                                 ComponentVisitor visitor)
Initiates a traversal of the component hierarchy within the specified Container in order to perform some repetitive task on all Components within the hierarchy. Each component in the hierarchy is passed to the visitor's visiting method for processing. The traversal is performed "pre-order" meaning that the Containers are processed before the contained Components have been visited. NOTE the Container itself is not processed.

Parameters:
container - the root of the component hiearchy
visitor - your ComponentVisitor subclass that performs the desired functionality
See Also:
postOrderVisit(java.awt.Container, com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.ComponentVisitor)

postOrderVisit

public static void postOrderVisit(Container container,
                                  ComponentVisitor visitor)
This method is similar to preOrderVisit, except that the traversal is performed "post-order" meaning that the Containers are visited after the contained Components have been visited.

See Also:
preOrderVisit(java.awt.Container, com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.ComponentVisitor)

getFontVisitor

public static ComponentVisitor getFontVisitor(Font font)
Obtain a ComponentVisitor that sets the Font for all Components within a given component hierarchy.

Parameters:

Returns:
a visitor instance that can be used with preOrderVisit or postOrderVisit

getRemoveListenersVisitor

public static ComponentVisitor getRemoveListenersVisitor()
Obtain a ComponentVisitor that removes AWT event listeners for each Component within a given component hierarchy. This can be useful when disposing a Dialog, or destroying an Applet, to ensure there are no "loitering listeners" that might otherwise prevent garbage collection of the dialog or applet subcomponents.

Returns:
a visitor instance that can be used with preOrderVisit or postOrderVisit
See Also:
preOrderVisit(java.awt.Container, com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.ComponentVisitor), postOrderVisit(java.awt.Container, com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.ComponentVisitor)
